page.title: 02Horncliffe Village.
page.content: Horncliffe is a small village at the extreme north of Northumberland County overlooking the River Tweed. It has some 82 houses with a population of about 192 in the village.In the village there is a Village Hall,a Church Hall and an Old School and each of these is used by the organisations in the village as meeting places.There is a Youth Club which uses the Old School,a thriving Women's Institute, whose members are also drawn from out- side the village,a Parish Council and a Village Hall Committee who all use the Village Hall. It is also used for the annual Bulb Show,the Onion Club and Leek Club Shows.A quoits club is based in the Fisher's Arms as is the local dart team.A Church Womens Guild use the Church Hall for their activities.
